message: Darkness.
I can't see or hear anything.
I can't tell left from right, or front from back.
Is this... Noiz's mind?
I stand there for a while as my eyes adjust to the dark. Eventually, I manage to make out some shapes.
But all there is to see are the lines of a floor and walls and ceiling. There's nothing else here.
It's an empty room.
Where is Noiz?
Suddenly, a rectangular hole opens in the wall to my right.
White light spills into the dark room. The shape of a person appears.
The person, slouched, wearing grey clothes with a white mask, shuffles into the room.
Identical copies of the person follow, slowly filling the room.
It's eerie窶病 dark room filled with monochrome figures窶浜ike all the color has been leeched from the world.
The masked people gather in the center of the room, forming a loose circle.
As the circle begins to turn, the white masks look almost as if they're crying.
My eyes are glued to the bizarre display. A moment later, something appears in the middle of the circle.
There's a strange distortion in the air, like the static on a malfunctioning television.
I peer through it and see what looks like a person, curled up on the floor.
Is that... Noiz?
...It is.
His eyes are closed, like he's sleeping.
...Noiz.
I try to call his name, but nothing comes out.
At that moment, the orderly circle of masked men starts to behave strangely.
They begin to sway to and fro, seemingly without coordination, and the sound of bones cracking fills the room.
Music comes from nowhere at all, blending with that awful sound.
The distorted rhythm twists into the frail screech of a worn-out record.
That, together with the scene I'm witnessing, fills me with a growing unease.
This conversation...
I'm inside Noiz's mind. These must be words he's heard before.
The people talking are probably his parents.
How... awful.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Noiz!"
I try to push my way through the circle of dancing figures.
But as I approach, the masked figures start moving differently. They start swaying to block my path.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Move! ...Ngh!"
For an instant, as I try to push them away, it looks as though my fingers are bent in strange directions. I pull my hand back in shock.
The masked figures sway as if mocking me.
I look down at my hand. It's fine.
Was that just an illusion?
I try pushing my way through the figures again.
Once again, my fingers twist. What the hell is this?
Every time I try to approach, my fingers twist and the figures laugh.
Are they... testing me? Saying that if I want to reach Noiz, I'll have to overcome the terror?
I know this isn't the real world. Nothing is really happening to my body.
But it feels real.
...Still, I don't have a choice.
Fighting against my fear, I approach.
I feel the unnatural sensation of flesh and bone twisting in my fingertips.
It's not real... It's not real...
Repeating the words in my head, I rush through the dancing figures.
When I touch them, they fall to the floor without resistance, flopping around like fish out of water.
Once they're all down, the static clears, and Noiz at last takes shape.
Suddenly, the room is silent.
